title: HK Pulse 3D Light Show gives cultural centre a summer look
text:
Home » travel » HK Pulse 3D Light Show gives cultural centre a summer look Light Show HK Pulse 3D Light Show gives cultural centre a summer look THE NATION July 23, 2015 10:30 am 
Hong Kong Pulse 3D Light Show lights up the night. Experience what a hot and cool summer destination Hong Kong is at the Hong Kong Pulse 3D Light Show from today until 2 August! Hong Kong Pulse 3D Light Show offers viewers an audio-visual treat, utilising 3D mapping technology to project vivid images onto the façade of the Hong Kong Cultural Centre and the Clock Tower in Tsim Sha Tsui, while upbeat music sets the mood Organised by the Hong Kong Tourism Board .(HKTB), the light show's summer version is in sync with the HKTB's "Hong Kong Summer Fun" promotion. With the theme "SHOP EAT PLAY", the light extravaganza highlights Hong Kong's appeal in shopping, dining and entertainment, with a kaleidoscope of cheerful visuals, including fruity summer drinks, ice pops and soft serves, sand castles, the underwater world, a fashion runway, a playground, and cute pandas playing lifeguards. The Hong Kong Pulse 3D Light Show is staged four times every evening, each session running for about eight minutes. Later in the year, two more light shows will be organised to coincide with the HKTB's Hong Kong WinterFest and Hong Kong Chinese New Year promotions, for an exciting addition to the city's traditional festivities. Hong Kong Pulse 3D Light Show Dates Now to 2 August 2015 (during Hong Kong Summer Fun) 9 to 28 December 2015 (during Hong Kong WinterFest) 10 to 29 February 2016 (during Hong Kong Chinese New Year) Time Four shows each evening, at 8:30pm, 9:00pm, 9:30pm, and 10:00pm. Each show lasts about 8 minutes. Vantage point Open Piazza, Hong Kong Cultural Centre, Tsim Sha Tsui Visit
